website_summaries.verdict: Mix away with a lightweight device that does its job without straining one's wrists.
pros: We love the blades that are more effective than other options and cut through firm food such as potatoes
Comes with spatula, whisk, instruction manual, and recipe book
cons: Starts up too high even when on "low

customer_reviews.title: Product Design Issue
customer_reviews.text: We have a number of Cuisinart small appliances as we've always found the brand to have excellent products...until now. The HM-70 hand mixer has a design flaw in which the beater attachment will not securely lock and hold into place. In reading other Amazon reviews of this product, I see other customers experienced the same issue. Would not recommend purchasing this mixer due to the issue as I now can't use it. Shouldn't have upgraded my old (and cheaper) hand mixer without all the extras as it never had issues or stopped working after years of use............... Attempted contacting Cuisinart via their website, but their product inquiry forms will not go through. Not helpful!
customer_reviews.author: BeBalanced

customer_reviews.title: Broken way too soon!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mixer in 2014 and it is now 2017. It is the highest rated mixer from CR and other sites. For about a year now the large beater will NOT stay in the mixer. I need a mixer that I can use both beaters. Do NOT buy! Price is too high for it to break so quickly! I had a $10 mixer from Walmart that the motor finally burned up that lasted from 1985 - 2014. I use my mixer about 6 times a year. This one is not the mixer of my dreams!
customer_reviews.author: kimberleypea

customer_reviews.title: Tried and True Name I've Always Counted n.
customer_reviews.text: My previous Cuisinart mixer of 10 plus years was still performing perfectly until I accidently spilled about one cup of beaten eggs into the motor and shorted it out. I went right to Amazon and reordered the updated model (seems to be the same model number, but the design was slightly different, but operates the same). All my former attachments (the whipper and beaters) all fit the new model so I can interchange them if I am mixing different batters. I trust the brand Cuisinart as it has served me well for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Beessonnet

customer_reviews.title: Burned out under light load. Warranty is 3 years. Lasted 4 years with occasional/light use. Won't buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon in 2012 which at the time of this writing was 4 years ago. It was a gift for my wife. She used it very little. While she was making "gobs" this morning it burned out with a strong electrical smell. Since we rarely used it, I checked the warranty. It's only for 3 years so we are out of luck. Mixing gobs (whoopie pies) is not an especially demanding task. The descriptions says this will mix cookie dough which is much denser and requires more torque. I am VERY unhappy with this unit and the warranty. I will not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: DWC

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioning less than a year later
customer_reviews.text: It's been exactly one year since my purchase, which I found out as a came online to see if it was too late to return it. It worked fine up until a month or two again when it became very difficult to push the speed adjustment buttons. I have to jam my fingernail into the button in multiple areas until I'm lucky enough to get a speed adjustment. Going with a trusted name like Cuisinart, I expected to have the mixer for several years, but it has lasted as long as a cheapo $10 version.
customer_reviews.author: Butler Fam

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not great!
customer_reviews.text: This worked for me for about 2 years. I was never thrilled with it. It did the job for the most part, but I did feel that if my butter was a bit cold, it couldn't get the lumps out because the beaters were too thin. The low speed started out low for a second then would work up to a moderate low, good for not spraying everything out of the bowl. Never felt like the high was that high unless I was beating eggs or cream. I didn't feel like it was strong enough for thicker batters.
customer_reviews.author: blessedtobemom

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: We have a stand mixer also, so this hand mixer got less use than it might otherwise have had. I've purchased two of these units and neither one lasted more than 2 years. It appears that the formerly highly regarded Cuisinart quality is NOT present in this product. The first one had the beater release lever (plastic) break off so there was no easy way to remove the beaters. The second unit just stopped working suddenly. Don't waste your money - get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Brunjes

customer_reviews.title: Poweful handmixer
customer_reviews.text: Has plenty of power and has worked very well over the past few years. Easy to clean surface, doesn't bog down when mixing thicker mixes like cookie dough or mashed potatoes. Like another reviewer states, when it switches on there is such a blast of power that it can splatter liquids and make dust clouds of dry ingredients, so be aware. Recommend you start at low setting and lower it into the mix after a few seconds when it has adjusted to the selected speed. Other than that, it's a great pick from the many out there.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondgirl

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Cuisinart Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Terrible...I've now had it over a year. It has no low speed mixing. It is fast, faster, and fastest. It splatters batter everywhere. You think you're losing your mind but it's the mixer. I am throwing it away and buying a KitchenAid mixer. I don't know why Cuisinart is cheapening everything they make, but they are, in my opinion. NO more Cuisinart anythings for me!
customer_reviews.author: Kruseski

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job, a little noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter as it was recommended by America’s test kitchen. She liked this better, as the previous one I bought the speed was way too high to begin with. So I now have 2 hand mixers! LOL
customer_reviews.author: NCFoodie

customer_reviews.title: Two defective units - poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived defective: the advertised Slow Start feature did not work -- the mixer starts at a very high speed, only later slowing down; and the slower speeds are all very erratic. Amazon cheerfully replaced it at no charge, but the second one was also defective, in essentially the same way. I returned that one for a refund, and as always was very pleased with Amazon's customer service. But clearly Cuisinart has a quality control issue with this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: HJimH

customer_reviews.title: This is a good mixer but I had hoped the low speed would ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mixer but I had hoped the low speed would just a little slower. It has a tendency to thrown whatever your mixing out of the bowl. It starts faster and then does slow down but by then, some of the batter has flown out. Overall it is a good hand held mixer. Perhaps I need to use a bigger bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Royal H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: SPLATTER MATTERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: SPLATTER MACHINE!!! There isn't a bowl deep enough to keep this beater from splattering all over the place--even on its lowest speed. I kept it because I was too lazy to return it. Have gone back to my oldie but goodie. Just tried it again after a long period of not using and was mixing up pumpkin pie filling. Yep... same old problem; splatter everywhere and I used the deepest mixing bowl I have. Completely impractical when you make such a mess every time you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Gardenista

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 years
customer_reviews.text: It was working great then I turned it off to mix some pancake batter & wanted to mix some more batter and nothing. Ugh. Oh well, I guess that's about what I can expect for a good price. Up till then I used it about 1 every 2 weeks for almost always a light batter or the occasional cookie recipe.For further info, it doesn't really have a slow setting, and was noisy. But easy dials. I guess it was me, but I kept wanting to eject the beater with the 'on' buttons & was afraid since I may have my hands on the beaters. But that was probably cause all my other hand mixers had the eject up top.
customer_reviews.author: Momma D

customer_reviews.title: The cookie dough that killed the CuisinartCuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mixer for about two years. It's a bit tall for my 5'2 self. I liked my old kitchen aid more. Tonight one of the beaters broke apart and actually twisted itself around the shaft of the mixer. It will cost $20 to replace the beaters. No thanks. Chocolate chip cookie dough was the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Love this mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love my mixer for everything and anything he does a great job comes with all gray attachments just not the mixing blade comes with a whip it comes the works awesome get it it’s the best
customer_reviews.author: THEODORE MALPEZZI JR

customer_reviews.title: No slow speed!
customer_reviews.text: Although this product claims to have 7 speeds, there virtually is not much difference among them. The worst of it is that the slowest speed is way too fast, making it impossible to fold dry and wet ingredients without the dry flying all over the place. What happened to the old hand mixers that used to have slower speeds to fold, blend, mix, etc.? I finally bought a vintage one to replace mine that no longer held one of the beaters. If you want a variation in speeds don't buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: Churchlady

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I make cookies for my church and purchased the Cuisinart Power Advantage to help me mix lots of cookie dough. I was so pleased with how it mixed my first batch with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Superbet9

customer_reviews.title: Good product,,,,,but -
customer_reviews.text: There are a couple of drawbacks,,,,, both minor. The mixer turns on and then the speed slows after a second...not a huge issue, but it throws out some droplets in the process. Also, the beaters tend to throw out mix at all the lower speeds ( up to #5) making it a little messier than other mixers I have used. It it not a lot...just splatters that land on me and the countertop.... again, a minor issue to me, but it keeps the rating at 4 stars instead of 5 stars. The mixer is pretty light, has good speed variables, and does a good job mixing all I have used it on
customer_reviews.author: John S. Moredock

customer_reviews.title: Splatter, Splatter, Splatter!!
customer_reviews.text: I've never written a review before but I'm so furious about this item that I felt compelled to warn others. When I use the whisks per the picture the contents of the bowl splatter EVERYWHERE and there is nothing you can do to stop it....splatter happens even at low speeds. I love the look of the item but prefer my Hamilton Beach (with fettuccine style whisk blades) that I have in my apartment. Never had a problem with that trusty old thing and will be replacing this with one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great and stylish looking hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Great hand mixer. A well constructed quality product. Easy to hold will in use and easy to clean. Very stylish looking, my wife loves it.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Ottini

customer_reviews.title: Nice hand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a hand mixer to replace my last one, which I had killed by using it to mix really thick batter. The most important features to me were that (1) it had a slow enough speed so dry ingredients wouldn't fly out of the bowl at the start of the mixing process; (2) it had a big enough motor to handle the thicker batters; and (3) it wasn't terribly heavy. I read many reviews, looking for comments on those things, chose this mixer, and am very pleased with all but the weight. In spite of that, after using it two or three times, I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Home Electric Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Best cheaply priced, quality electric hand mixer. Wife uses this, and doesn't like junk. One of her favorite tools in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ish Wish Dish

customer_reviews.title: works well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: works well for the price. the only issue I have with it is it has no way to "sit it down" in your counter flat so you always have the whisks touching the countertop in some way making more of a mess
customer_reviews.author: Justme

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you plan to bake
customer_reviews.text: This mixer boasts that it has on demand power. It might be okay if you are whipping cool whip, but w/ anything w/ substance it is horrible. I bought this as a gift for my wife, on the second use she was making cookies. The unit started to smoke and smell like the motor burned out, she had to switch to her old kitchen-aid that can still do the job after years of baking. Since I bought this as a gift in advance, I can no longer return this item. A very expensive paperweight. My mistake in thinking Cuisinart was a good brand. The professional ratings must be bogus. Be forewarned!
customer_reviews.author: Rk1ind

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I am a little disappointed in this as in reading the reviews, it stated it starts out slow and then picks up, which I have found to be the opposite, it starts out fast and then slows down to the speed it should be. Also the beaters are sometimes a challenge as I have trouble getting one of them to stay in and have to switch them. I paid more for this than others that may have done as well. I do like it that it doesn't have a power booster like my last beater as they are sometimes more of a nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie EM

customer_reviews.title: NOT GREAT WITH STEAMY POTATOES!
customer_reviews.text: This a great hand mixer as long as you do not use it with hot steaming ingredients, such as potatoes, butternut squash and the like. The steam SHUTS down the machines ability to work. Whips cream perfectly to up to dense cookie batters.Machine is going back as we are more at to mix potatoes verses cookie batter.
customer_reviews.author: cabquilts

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t the mixer you may be looking for. The color choices are cool - but it’s light plastic and doesn’t want to mix like some bigger name models. One things that’s a glaring oversight is that turning it on, it starts extremely fast and then you have to turn it down... that’s reverse of logic. In a nutshell... ‘meh’
customer_reviews.author: Lonski

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: After checking out many reviews for all kinds of hand-mixers and deciding on this one, I can say that I'm so happy with my choice. It works extremely well, has a powerful motor, is simple to use, and a great value. Other reviewers have noted that there's a surge of power when you first turn it on (when you have it at a low-speed setting), so the beaters turn really fast for a second or two before settling into a slower speed - I find this to also be true, but it's easy to combat by just holding the beaters out of the batter for a second after hitting the power button.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a few tweeks
customer_reviews.text: The mixer does what it should and has good power. The soft start feature does not work as it initially goes very fast, slows down, and then speeds up to running speed. Minus one star for that. Also, the trigger release for the beaters takes some getting used to. I am used to pulling the trigger on power tools to make them run, not spit out the attachments. Minus one star for that.
customer_reviews.author: scottk

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Held Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love our. It's great. Second one I purchased because the first I left with my mom. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Doralee B. Bohner

customer_reviews.title: Got it for the layout of the Controls.
customer_reviews.text: Ditched the 'old' mixer after the wife nearly cut off her finger due to the 'tricky switch' on Thanksgiving Day. Confused the Beater Eject for the Power button. Not good. Looked and Looked at WalMart for a decent mixer. Gave up. Got this one especially for the layout of the controls. Everyone still has their fingers.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Well built and versatile hand-mixer
customer_reviews.text: Nice hand mixer. I needed a small mixer and this one fits the bill. The 7 speeds provide an excellent speed range for most mixtures. The unit is well built and is suitable for heavy batter. I would of giving this mixer a 5-star rating, but even though it has a soft-slow start feature, I find it still tends to overspin on startup. I wish it would control the spin-up a little better, though this is a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: CraigB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacements.
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased as replacement beaters and work every bit as well as the originals. They fit the Cuisinart mixer perfectly and are released easily at the push of the button. We are considering getting another set so we don't have to wash or rinse these between jobs.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Works (mostly) great!
customer_reviews.text: Works well through thick and thin batters, cleans up easily, and the ambidextrous cord is handy! The only thing I don't like is the "slow start" feature that's never worked for me. In fact, instead of spooling up gently, it whirs right passed whatever you have it set for and has to slow back down. The beaters and whisk both work well, but the beaters are thin enough that I rarely ever user the whisk.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Love, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kitchen Aid hand mixer. Even though it had 3 power settings, the high setting was barely powerful enough to whip potatoes. My daughter had the same one and stated the same thing. This Cuisinart is absolutely wonderful. I wish I would have discovered it years ago. This is a keeper and I will never own any other brand. When the life time of this mixer expires I will deffinitely be replaceing it with an identical model. I give it a three thumbs up! (That is if I had three thumbs! lol)
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fell Short of Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I read several reviews and shopped around before settling on this mixer. It feels sturdy and the beaters come in and out easily. It stores nicely and is very responsive to adjustments in speed. The problem is that the motor just doesn't stand-up to use in thicker batters. I read others saying they made double batches of cookies with ease, but that certainly wasn't my experience. Even single batches of a thick dough or large batches of thin items like brownies left a burning odor in the air.
customer_reviews.author: Claire C.

customer_reviews.title: Great hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: This hand mixer is the best one I have ever owned. I love to bake, so it gets used often and for all type of doughs and batters. Standard beaters and a whisk attachment were included with my mixer. Also, I would recommend purchasing the dough hook attachments if you work with thicker or heavier batters. The dough hooks are great for mixing cookies (I'll use the standard beaters for creaming the butter and sugar, and then switch to the dough hooks when it is time to incorporate the flour).
customer_reviews.author: csps7510

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just used this product for the first time and was very pleased with the "slow start" to keep liquids and flour from spattering all over the place. I like the easy beater-release feature as well. The on/off button is great, too, as you don't have to slow down the speed to stop the mixer. Really convenient for one-hand operation while turning the bowl. Haven't used it yet for whipping up egg whites for a stiff meringue. If it does that as well, I will rate it a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart 7 -Speed Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I am using the mixer a great deal since it's easier to clean and move around than my Kitchen Aid stand mixer and is more convenient for smaller jobs like whipping a small batch of cream. I need to be careful and use a deep bowl since when making something with dry ingredients the initial speed tends to scatter flour out of a shallower mixing bowl. So far it's working well and I like the ease with which I can change speeds and pop out the beaters for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful AND Functional!  Exceeded my expectations by a long shot!
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful hand mixer! It adjusts its speed based on the resistance of whatever you're mixing. When you pull it out of the bowl, it slows itself down so there's not major splatter. This may be standard to most hand mixers these days, but my previous mixer didn't do that, not even close! I love the retro look to it, and think this is a perfect alternative to the less affordable stand mixers.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Infrequently used, but beaters are now too loose
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this 4 and a half years after my purchase-seems like just a couple of years! I don't use a mixer often, but recently the beater housings have loosened to the point that the beaters now sometimes hit each other and make a terrible noise. So I will have to replace my mixer and plan to look for a different one that might last longer. I don't think this one should be worn out, given its infrequent use.
customer_reviews.author: BobberAnn

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Easy to Use Hand Mxer
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to use, and clean and such a pretty color.
customer_reviews.author: Karen1216

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: We did like the mixer but gave it a one star due to customer service. It worked great until smoke started to pour out of the mixer exhaust housing after 11 months of use. This I can understandable since it could happen 1 month to 2 years later. This happen 11 months after we purchased the mixer through Amazon. Called Cruisinart customer service and they said that I would have to ship it to them on my dime and also that I would have to give them $10 for shipment back to me. With the $20 that I would have to spend for a mixer (paid $59, with 3 year warranty), it would be better spent on a new mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Golda-Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: It's not what they say!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this mixer specially for this feature: "SmoothStart feature: When the mixer is turned on, the beaters start spinning very slowly to prevent ingredients from splattering." This is exactly what they say in product features but when the mixer is turned on, the beaters start spinning fast and then slow down! I thought my mixer has a problem and called Cuisinart. They said this is the way it should be because of the new technology but I didn't get the answer of what I should do with the flour or sugar powder that is now out of the bowl!!! But it's really powerful and this is the reason I haven't returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva Siavoshy

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand mixer. I use it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Maring

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Had this now for a few months and I am happy with my purchase. When I turn it on I expect the fast start so it's not a surprise. Works great with custards, cookies, and cake mixes. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I researched quite a few hand mixers before choosing this one to replace my Grandma's 1960's aqua hand mixer. I had always wanted the Kitchen Aid stand mixer, but never had room for it. This mixer is powerful enough to mix stiff cookie dough easily, whips cream or egg whites quickly with the whisk attachment, cleans up easily and stores in a small space. Many reviewers complained about the start up causing splattering, but I find if I hold the mixer down in the bowl, I didn't have a problem with it. It also helps to use a deep bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Ellis

customer_reviews.title: A great portable mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have always approached these portable mixers as a kind of necessary evil. I have two stand mixers but there are lots of times when I just want to do a small task and don't want all the bother. After burning another portable out a few months ago I figured I would limp along with an old one and when it went I was going to buy the best I could. I did and I love it. Thank you Cuisinart for such a great produce and Amazon for such a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Salt Lake Joan

customer_reviews.title: works fine, good range of speeds
customer_reviews.text: This is vastly superior to the 20 year old basic Hamilton Beach that it replaced. The range of speeds is more than sufficient for my purposes. This can stiffen up those egg whites in 30 seconds or so and has a lot of oomph.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Power burst at start up
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good mixer, it is a Cuisinart after all, but the one thing I can not stand about it is the burst of power it goes through when it is first turned on. It happens every time it gets turned on and every time whatever is in the mixing bowl gets splattered all over the place. I have finally reached the point where, when I remember to do it, I actually turn it on before I put it in with the ingredients in order to avoid all the mess. If I had known it would do this burst of power business I would not have purchased this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Davida Copperfield

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic construction - do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: There isn’t a lot of power - it shakes when it’s in use and shakes more at higher settings. If i’d Have kept the packaging when I got it I would have tried to return it. Spend a bit more and invest in something solid.
customer_reviews.author: TaraNYC

customer_reviews.title: One mixer does all
customer_reviews.text: Took a bit to get used to the start up speed, but after 2 baking situations, I got a “handle” on it
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, powerful hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: After debating whether to get a $250 KitchenAid bowl mixer, I purchased this Cuisinart hand mixer. It does everything I need, and seems like it will last a long time. I've used to to make breads, mashed potatoes, cookies, and guacamole. With a couple months of light use, there's still a slight electrical smell coming from the motor when it runs. I remember this from previous mixers and hope it goes away with time. Without the smell, I would have rated this hand mixer 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little beauty ignoring the other reviews that talked about the weird speeds on it. Well the electronics on the top have gone out and it no longer works correctly. I bought this on October 22, 2014 and when I tried to return it I was advised the return period ran out November 22, 2014. Cute, Amazon. I have been a customer with Amazon for many years and I plan to replace this item. However, it won't be another Cuisinart, there will be no electronics on it and it won't be through Amazon. I'm looking at a Kitchen Aid at JC Penny's and guess what - it has a one year warranty!
customer_reviews.author: dmac

customer_reviews.title: 3 speed
customer_reviews.text: Slowly dying. Bought 2011 and worked fine for five years then lost 1,2,3,4 speeds only works on 5,6 and 7 so I'm limited. Will replace soon
customer_reviews.author: B. Salinas

customer_reviews.title: best mixer I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer, especially the beater release. I've always had trouble pushing the release button but on this mixer you pull up and it's easy to pull. I was surprised to find I like the thinner beaters. They work better than the wider beaters. Can't think of a single thing I dislike about this mixer. I would certainly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Gram

customer_reviews.title: Keep shopping, this is not the mixer for you
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with this appliance; even at the slowest speed, it sprays ingredients onto my walls, cabinets and counter tops. Using my deepest mixing bowl, the HM-70 mixer flings, splatters, splashes and tosses ingredients across my kitchen with wild abandon. The slow-start feature is a joke. It is really a power-blaster designed to smear my clothes with sticky, floury, goopy ingredients. The digital controls are difficult to access. The "chrome" is really plastic. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: steph mczen

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer and plwnty of power.
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this mixer and we sent our Kitchen Aid Mixer back to QVC, ss it had no power like he Cusisnart HM-70. JB-NV
customer_reviews.author: JB-NV

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for my old Cuisinart Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I had my other Cuisinart mixer for at least 15 years, and used it constantly. It finally started to make a noise that I did not like when I did heavy duty mixing but it still worked perfectly with the whipping attachment for whipped cream or egg whites. I replaced it with this newer model which is like my original one and I know this will probably work for me as long as I am able to work with it, since I am in my mid 70's now.
customer_reviews.author: N. White

customer_reviews.title: Great ... 4 start
customer_reviews.text: This is one great mixer .. I really love the way it starts slowly and lets me decide when to turn up the speed. The only thing I was disappointed in was the beaters.. They are not as well made as I would expect from Cuisinart. They seem a little flimsy ... but are easy to wash. It has the power to handle any thing I used it for so far. Mixed up my Royal Icing with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Cookygram

customer_reviews.title: I hate the quick speed start up
customer_reviews.text: I hate the quick speed start up. When you turn on the mixer the motor speeds up to the maximum speed, even when you select a lower speed when you turn it on. I replaced this mixer with an $12 Hamilton Beach 5 speed mixer which does the job at a very much lower price. I see from other reviewers that they have experienced the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Great Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Very happy. Tried it out to make sure it worked, and electrically - it all works, but I haven't yet used it to make anything. Nevertheless, I am confident that it will do a great job next time I have to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M Schulman

customer_reviews.title: A bargain
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mixer about 6 months now and I think it is my favorite. The beaters felt a little flimsy compared to past beaters, but they are holding up very well. The highest speed is quite impressive and when you turn it on it starts out very slowly for a second or two, then goes to the slowest regular speed.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: ... bread to date with the mixer but it is sturdy and the fact that is always starts at the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only made banana bread to date with the mixer but it is sturdy and the fact that is always starts at the slowest speed does save a lot of splatters. It seems to have ample power, the beater blades are sturdy. Ihas a flat back so it will set securlyon the counter. I am a seasoned cook and this hand mixer is the best one I have ever had. Cuisinart Rocks!
customer_reviews.author: M. L. R.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong motor, easy controls
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the quality of this mixer. I ordered 2 mixers, both for gifts. The weight was very managable and the controls easy for an elderly lady with arthritis who uses her mixer almost daily. She said there is plenty of power for heavier batters. The only negative comment I received was that the beaters not constructed of flat pieces of metal, they are round. So they have a hard time "cutting" thru thick doughs. The motor has no problem turning, but the dough just balls up and doesn't mix.
customer_reviews.author: A. Finney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I love the slow start when starting mixing which keeps the contents in the bowl, not on the wall. It moves smoothly up through the speeds. Controls are easy to use and function perfectly. It's light weight makes it possible to work with without strain. Cleans up easily and stores well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handmixer
customer_reviews.text: I love this hand mixer. Installing the beaters are so easy and the release is fabulous. Being it is digital when you turn on it starts out on one which is a nice slow start then you can increase the speed. When you shut off it goes back to zero. I recently returned one to the store couldn't get the blades in or released. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good mixer. Feels solid and powerful. I have few issues with it. First, when it starts it has some sort of speed jolt for 1-2 seconds before slowing down to the minimum speed. That could send some flour flying around. Second, it does not lay on the mixing bowl well when you need to temporarily rest it there. It slides off easily. Third, the cord is stiff.
customer_reviews.author: ValVe

customer_reviews.title: Just Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mixer, does exactly what it says.......I really appreciate the low speed when adding dry ingredients, that was one of the deciding factors in buying this particular model, couldn't be happier!! Now let's hope it lasts as long as my old mixer (15 yrs.); would recommend this to anyone looking for a good and powerful hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: EEW

customer_reviews.title: Stupid design
customer_reviews.text: Turned it on and it went zoom and then slowed down then zoom again and slowed down and kept doing that until we went to a higher speed. Apparently from reading the reviews this is normal. Not acceptable tho. I want a slow speed that is starts slow and stays slow. Sent it back. Also the Chrome appears to be plated plastic. Doubt it would look good for very long.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Kinner

customer_reviews.title: pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by the ease with which this could be handled. Beaters go on and come off with ease, and, the slow start-up speed is welcome, especially for someone who has regular stand mixer, and, forgets to turn the speed down when adding flour. This is especially handy in mixing small amounts when the standing mixer just will not get down to all the nooks and crannies in the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Joanzie

customer_reviews.title: what did I wait for
customer_reviews.text: My old mixer finally died and being retired, I now like to bake and this works great. It is a pleasure to make batter and not have the mixer stop with it being too thick. This handles peanut butter mixes and I haven't had it not handle something yet. It does start out fast so I just start it before I put it in the mix and it's fine. Great choice.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Does the job I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: It works well. Love the slow start. The only thing that bugs me is the swivel cord base. When I'm in a hurry, I don't have time to make sure it's in the right place, and half the time it falls over. That's the only reason for 4 stars, instead of 5. I haven't tried it for cookie dough, as I use my KitchenAid stand mixer for that.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Drummond

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, solid performer
customer_reviews.text: My old hand mixer finally died after years and years of use, so I ordered this one and am very happy with it. Good power (I don't have a stand mixer) and mixes batters and quick bread mixes quickly and efficiently without strain. Seems to be plenty of power and the mixer isn't heavy and is easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: sfb

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job mixing!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer - I have used it on many recipes and have been impressed with the speed and how it handles. Friends have commented on the nice style of it. The only thing I don't like it the tiny burst at the front and then it slows down to a proper speed to begin mixing. Otherwise, it would be full 5 star!
customer_reviews.author: Kalani

customer_reviews.title: I'd give this 6 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this yesterday and was so excited that I had to bake a cake to try it out! I have a BIG KitchenAid stand mixer, but wanted something handier. I was blown away by the Cuisinart 7 Speed! In a couple seconds the oil/eggs/water was completely blended, and then the batter was soft and smooth in no time at all! LOVE the slow start feature! And I like that I can turn it OFF without going back down all the speeds. I love this so much, I'm thinking about giving one as a Christmas gift!
customer_reviews.author: LaLa728

customer_reviews.title: As pleased as "America's Test Kitchen" said I'd be
customer_reviews.text: This mixer was recommended by "America's Test Kitchen" and since their testing and recommendations have yet to disappoint I followed their recommendation. Mixer is easy to handle, the speed control very simple to operate, and it does a beautiful job if you follow the speed and attachment recommendations in the accompanying recipe book. Also comes with the whisk attachment, which I have not used, and a plastic spatula that looks as though it will be useless. The beaters are a dream to clean after a lifetime of dealing with beaters that have a center post. All in all an excellent purchase that I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Leonards

customer_reviews.title: Great Mixer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kitchenaid for 10 years and I loved it. The beaters broke and that caused the engine to work overly hard and it bit the dust. Replaced it with this one because of the slower speed. Used it through the holidays and it performed like a trooper. I love it even more than my old one so far. Easier to clean also. The power advantage works great for chocolate chip cookies and mashed potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirly

customer_reviews.title: Great hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hand mixer from Amazon for my daughter, but before I could give it to her, she bought one. I decided to keep it and I'm happy that I did. I especially like how the beaters are designed. They are much easier to clean. The speed and power seem perfect for my needs. I'm very pleased wit the mixer, the price and the speed in which it was delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart 7-speed Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this purchase! The Cuisinart 7-speed hand mixer makes mixing chocolate chip cookie dough a breeze! I look forward to baking cookies now that I have a mixer that really does the trick. Besides its good looks, the motor is ample .. I haven't pass speed 3 yet! I have no doubt this little mixer will be able to whip up whipping cream in a jiffy! I would highly recommend the Cuisinart 7-speed hand mixer. I can't imagine why there's even a 9-speed by Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl B.

customer_reviews.title: Since when is zero start an option?
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to have adjustment starting at zero. Well...kinda. I am used to mixers that completely started at zero, or very close to it. This still starts a bit too high, but does get there slower. Almost, but not quite!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wiscman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, good value in a hand held
customer_reviews.text: Very effective. Flexible speeds. Dishwasher safe beaters. Plenty of power to cream sugar. I've been using it for several months and I like it. Like the slow start feature, too.
customer_reviews.author: NotTheDude

customer_reviews.title: Itspowerful
customer_reviews.text: It's wonderful and even works on our old German recipe Sollen that wore out our ould mixer. The only problem we had was somehow we got two,sent to us,however , bed bath and beyond and Amazon.com took care of everything .
customer_reviews.author: kenneth thompson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have used many hand mixers in my decades in the kitchen. This is by far the best one I have ever used. For the price, I am thrilled. I know that other more and less expensive mixers have lived in my kitchen, and I will hopefully use this one for many years to come. It's both very heavy duty for bigger jobs, but at the same time allows true lower speed control. I own and love my stand mixer, but for smaller jobs I'm thrilled to have a hand mixer that can get the job done this well.
customer_reviews.author: Havinfun11

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: Slow start is slow enough that it does not throw whatever you're mixing all over the place. The included beaters (2X) and whisk (1X) pops out easily when you press the release button, which is located in a convenient place. Powerful but still lightweight enough that you don't feel too much of a strain if you have to mix for a long time. A keeper!
customer_reviews.author: vicky

customer_reviews.title: Smooth power mixer
customer_reviews.text: Smooth and powerful. Nicest hand mixer I've owned. The separate on/off button and digital power control takes getting use too after a manual adjuster that does both. Not light weight so not for those with arthritis or difficulty holding onto heavy objects. I would purchase this mixer again. It makes the best whipped cream with the special whisk attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Suzncruz

customer_reviews.title: Highest Rated
customer_reviews.text: This mixer was rated the highest by Cooks Magazine and by Amazon. They were right. Best portable I've ever owned. Really like the design of the beaters as well as the "true" low speed. The digital increases in speed are also very nice and I like the idea that the mixer always starts out in low. This little machine really works as well as my big stand mixer. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Martha R

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful power/ a little messy
customer_reviews.text: Love the power. Love the look. I have no issue with the fast/slow start up. It really is a NON- ISSUE. But it really is a little messy if you don't use a deep bowl with somewhat straight sides. I have only used it for 3 or 4 months. So I am hopeful that it will last a few years. So far; love it!

customer_reviews.title: Great powerhouse handheld machine!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don’t like is when you go to first turn it on, even at the lowest speed, it starts out high so flour or sugar flies everywhere! Other than that, I reallly like it a lot!!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart is not what it once was - warranty program is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great about 15 times over a year and a half. Started to fail (wouldn't come up to speed). I'm currently in the warranty replacement process with Cuisinart. The replace will cost me about $20. This is absurd. Cuisinart requires you to ship it to them and to send them $10 to cover their shipping and handling.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Underriner

customer_reviews.title: fast
customer_reviews.text: it starts a little fast but it slows and works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great mixer
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous mixer. Not too heavy, does a great job mixing, and the eject button is incredibly easy to operate. Also, its placement (the eject button) is very well thought-out. I would recommend this mixer to anyone looking for something portable. It even comes with a whisk for egg whites and heavy cream. I am very pleased with this item.
customer_reviews.author: capemaychristy

customer_reviews.title: Mix it up!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for about a month and am very happy with it, especially the low speeds at the bottom of the range. My previous mixer was never slow enough to avoid splattering. My only wish is for a retractable cord, but on the whole I am very happy with it and the Cuisinart line in general.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Power is to YOUR advantage!
customer_reviews.text: This handsome machine does not disappoint. It has what is essential in a hand mixer; multiple speeds, sturdy horsepower, and beaters with the proper shape to effectivly whip egg whites or cream. I got my tip from Cooks Illustrated magazine product reviews, which completes very thorough studies and comparisons. I count on a good hand mixer as I don't have a counter top stand mixer such as a Kitchen Aid. I love the charcoal color that cleans up easier (than white).
customer_reviews.author: P. Howe

customer_reviews.title: The slow start feature is much better than my 20 yo mixer
customer_reviews.text: Fairly light. Works well. The slow start feature is much better than my 20 yo mixer. Will see about durability as I use it more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light In Weight And Powerful
customer_reviews.text: My spouse was not happy with her previous handheld mixer. After reviewing information about handhelds she decided to purchase the Cuisinart. It is much better that her old mixer. Light in weight and powerful. She's pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Vbg

customer_reviews.title: Power mixer
customer_reviews.text: This mixer has really provided just what I need, mixing cake batter at the right speed and really helped me make stiff peaks from egg whites and also helped me make homemade whipped cream as well. Hopefully this mixer will last me a long time. Great silver finish on the mixer as well.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Vanish

customer_reviews.title: so good. This hand mixer is much more heavy duty ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This hand mixer is much more heavy duty than my other one and feels like it will last forever. The variable speeds make mixing easy. The speeds can be changed very easily and quickly
customer_reviews.author: JTW

customer_reviews.title: Has a nice slow speed start.
customer_reviews.text: after much research this model allows for a slow speed and plenty of higher range.
customer_reviews.author: MikeR

product_meta.title: Cuisinart HM-70 Power Advantage 7-Speed Hand Mixer, Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver

CUISINART POWER ADVANTAGE 7-SPEED HAND MIXER
Thanks to its powerful 220-watt motor with automatic feedback, this convenient hand blender can take on almost any mixing task--from whipped cream to dense cookie dough. The unit shifts speeds with just one touch and offers seven speed options. It also comes equipped with an exclusive swivel cord, which allows for either right- or left-handed use, and extra-long beaters that have no center posts, making cleanup a snap either by hand or in the dishwasher. Accessories include a spatula and an instruction/recipe book for getting started. Durably built and sporting a chrome-plated Cuisinart logo band, the hand mixer measures approximately 8 by 3-3/4 by 5-3/4 inches. 

The chrome-plated Cuisinart logo band makes this hand mixer a sleek electric for your kitchen. The 3-inch-diameter whisk adds superior whipping and aerating volume to whipped cream and creates stiff, fine-textured egg whites. The extra-long, extra-wide beaters are designed without center post to prevent ingredients from clogging up beaters. Beaters are easy to clean and completely dishwasher safe. IT’S TIME TO MIX IT UP!
Get ready to enjoy more mixing opportunities with the extremely versatile Cuisinart Power Advantage 7-Speed Hand Mixer. The Cuisinart Power Advantage 7-Speed Hand Mixer flawlessly and easily mixes even the heaviest ingredients. From dense cookie dough to whipped cream, the powerful 220-watt motor breezes through big mixing jobs, and Automatic Feedback kicks in more power whenever it’s needed. Don’t worry about messy splatters... the Smooth Start feature, with its 3 extra-low speeds, keeps all the ingredients right in the bowl where they belong!

PRODUCT FEATURES
• 220 Watts of Power: Powerful enough to easily cut through a double batch of cookie dough or butter right out of the refrigerator. 

 • 3 Low Mixing Speeds: Lower mixing speeds provide greater control when folding or mixing dry ingredients. 

 • Easy To Clean: The Power Advantage Hand Mixer has a smooth, sealed base; wipes clean instantly. 

 • Heel Rest: Allows mixer to rest squarely on countertop. 

 • One-Step On/Off Switch: One-step power switch allows you to turn mixer on and off in a single operation. 

 • LED Speed Display: Digital speed settings are easy to read. 

 • One-Touch Speed Control: Allows you to change speeds quickly while you are mixing. 

 • Maximum Comfort: Balanced to do more work for you. The shape of the mixer allows maximum possible power and balance. Stress-free grip provides unparalleled comfort and control, even during extended mixing. 

 • Automatic Feedback: No need for a power boost. An electronic feedback mechanism automatically feeds in extra power when needed. It assures that the mixer will not bog down, even when mixing heavy loads. 

 • SmoothStart feature: When the mixer is turned on, the beaters start spinning very slowly to prevent ingredients from splattering. 

 • Exclusive Rotating Swivel Cord: Unique swivel cord can be positioned for comfortable right- or left-handed use. 

 • Spatula, instruction manual and recipe booklet included

7 speed options; slide control easily shifts speeds with a single touch
Swivel cord; extra-long dishwasher-safe beaters; beater-eject lever
Spatula, chef's whisk, instruction/recipe book included
Product Built to North American Electrical Standards
